dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon
News Content: Nvidia (NVDA)

Chipmaker Nvidia has overtaken Apple (AAPL) once again to become the world's most valuable company, after the company's shares rose in Tuesday's session.

Nvidia now has a market capitalisation of nearly $3.45tn (£2.79tn), compared to Apple's $3.35tn, with shares in the iPhone maker having fallen 3% in the previous session.

Shares in Nvidia climbed more than 2% on Tuesday and were up 2.5% in pre-market trading on Wednesday.

This came after newly reinstated president Donald Trump announced a new $500bn private sector investment to build artificial infrastructure in the US.

Read more: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise as UK borrowing jumps unexpectedly

Initial equity funders for the "Stargate Project" are OpenAI, Oracle (ORCL), SoftBank (9984.T) and MGX, while Nvidia is one of the initial technology partners.

Ben Barringer, technology analyst at Quilter Cheviot, said: "This development is undeniably a boon for the AI sector. Companies involved in supplying the technology and infrastructure for Project Stargate are well-positioned to benefit significantly.

"The move underscores the increasing strategic importance of AI innovation, further solidifying its role as a cornerstone of economic and technological advancement. For investors in the AI space, this announcement highlights a wealth of opportunities as the competition to dominate the sector intensifies."

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Oracle (ORCL)

Shares in Oracle jumped 7% on Tuesday and were up 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday morning, following Trump's announcement.

The stock was also trending after Trump reportedly said at event on Tuesday that he would be open to Oracle chairman Larry Ellison or Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk purchasing social media app TikTok, as part of a joint venture with the US government.

According to a Bloomberg report, Trump said: "I have the right to make a deal."

"So what I’m thinking about saying to somebody is buy it and give half to the United States of America, half, and we’ll give you the permit, and they’ll have a great partner," he added.

Read more: Pound, gold and oil prices in focus: commodity and currency check, 22 January

In one of his early actions after being sworn in for a second presidential term on Monday, Trump signed an executive order to delay the ban of TikTok in the US.

When asked about Trump's proposal that TikTok-owner, Chinese company ByteDance, hand over half of the platform to a US company, China foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said: "TikTok has operated in the US for years and been very popular with American users."

Story Continues

"It has played a positive role in boosting US employment and consumption. We hope the US will earnestly listen to the voice of reason and provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for market entities from all countries."

•USD

(ORCL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Netflix (NFLX)

Shares in Netflix soared 14% in pre-market trading on Wednesday, after the streaming giant reported 18.9 million users in the fourth quarter, with revenue and earnings also beating expectations.

Revenue of $8.83bn for the fourth quarter was up 12.5% year-on-year and diluted earnings per share came in at $2.11 for the final three months of its fiscal year.

The company also announced a $15bn share buyback and raised its full-year revenue outlook to come in between $43.5bn and $44.5bn. That was ahead of its prior range of $43bn to $44bn.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Strong subscriber gains came on the back of Netflix ending 2024 with two back-to-back NFL games, a successful "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match, and the return of the highly-popular "Squid Game" series.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "Netflix keeps us hooked with fresh content slates, drawing millions of new viewers while keeping existing customers happy at the same time. This is the last quarter Netflix will report net subscriber growth, and it’s blown expectations out of the water.

"While rivals hike prices and wrestle with losses, Netflix is raking in cash and striking deals like WWE and NFL to strengthen its lineup. Competitors selling their best shows to Netflix only make its library stronger, keeping us watching – and, crucially, paying."

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Adidas (ADS.DE)

In Europe, shares in sportswear brand Adidas surged nearly 7% on Wednesday morning, after the company posted stronger-than-expected preliminary fourth quarter results.

Adidas revenues grew 24% to €5.97bn (£5.05tn) in the fourth quarter, while operating profit reached €57m in the quarter, versus an operating loss of €377m.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The jump in the shares helped drive the pan-European STOXX 600 (^STOXX) to an all-time high on Wednesday morning.

Deutsche Bank analysts said in a note on Wednesday that they had a "buy" rating on the stock.

"Our buy case on Adidas is built on increasing brand heat, positive earnings momentum and strong EPS growth," they said. "All of this is evidenced again in 4Q."

•USD

(ADS.DE)

Follow  View Quote Details

JD Wetherspoon (JDW.L)

Shares in UK pub operator JD Wetherspoon dipped nearly 2% into the red on Wednesday, after the company's chairman Tim Martin warned of higher costs.

Martin had already warned that costs at Wetherspoons would increase this year by £60m per annum, on the back of increases in the autumn budget to employer national insurance contributions and the national minimum wage.

Read more: Higher-than-expected UK borrowing heaps pressure on Rachel Reeves

"Government-mandated wage increases have a significantly bigger impact on pub and restaurant companies than supermarkets," Martin said.

Derren Nathan, head of equity research at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "There’s no more vociferous campaigner for landlord rights than chairman Tim Martin who has pointed out that volumes of pub’s biggest product line, beer, have collapsed by 52% between 2000 and 2023.

"Average on-trade prices are now at £4.98 per pint and far more sensitive to labour cost increases than supermarket equivalents, where you can pick up 568 ml of refreshment for an average price of £1.20."

In the trading update, JD Wetherspoon reported 5.1% growth in like-for-like sales.

•USD

(JDW.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Apple (AAPL)

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news highlights that Nvidia has overtaken Apple in market capitalization, which could indicate a weakening confidence in Apple's competitiveness in the tech sector, especially with the ongoing boom in AI led by Nvidia. Additionally, AAPL shares fell 3% in the previous session, suggesting some existing negative sentiment. While Apple remains a strong company, the immediate effect of Nvidia's rise and the general bullish sentiment around AI may not favor AAPL in the short term. Thus, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price falling relative to the chance of it rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple's stock fell 3% in the previous session and Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. This suggests negative sentiment toward Apple, potentially leading to further price decline. While Apple is mentioned in other news, such as companies 'in the news' on Wednesday, the overall tone is not favorable.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on other companies, with Apple only mentioned in passing as having been overtaken by Nvidia in market capitalization.  While Apple's stock fell 3% the previous session, this article doesn't provide any specific information that directly impacts Apple's future performance. The positive news for Nvidia and the overall AI sector might create a slightly negative sentiment for Apple in the short term, as investors shift focus to other companies.  However, the overall impact on Apple's stock price from this news is expected to be relatively minor.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights that Nvidia has overtaken Apple to become the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. The news also mentions a significant investment in AI infrastructure, which benefits Nvidia and other tech partners but does not directly favor Apple. Given that Apple's market capitalization has been surpassed and its shares fell recently, the sentiment around Apple in this context appears neutral to slightly negative. However, Apple's strong fundamentals and ecosystem may mitigate some downside risk.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news headline and content mention several companies, but the specific impact on Apple Inc. (AAPL) is that Nvidia has overtaken Apple to become the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. This indicates a negative short-term impact on Apple's stock price due to the comparative performance of Nvidia. However, the overall market and sector performance could influence Apple's stock price movement. Given the information, there is a higher likelihood of Apple's stock price falling in the short term due to the direct comparison and Nvidia's surge, but the probabilities also consider the broader market context and potential for recovery.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news mentions that Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Nvidia's market capitalization at $3.45tn and Apple's at $3.35tn. This change in market capitalization ranking, combined with the 3% fall in Apple's shares in the previous session, suggests a potential downward trend for Apple's stock price. Additionally, the news highlights Nvidia's involvement in the 'Stargate Project' and the positive impact on the AI sector, which may further contribute to Apple's relative decline. However, it's essential to consider that Apple's stock price can be influenced by various factors, including its own financial performance, industry trends, and overall market conditions.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The financial news primarily focuses on other companies and does not have direct impacts on Apple's stock performance. However, Apple's stock fell 3% in the previous session, and the surrounding news around Nvidia could potentially influence investor sentiment negatively if Nvidia continues to outperform. Still, the factors affecting Apple are not explicitly mentioned in this news.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news indicates a significant development where Nvidia has overtaken Apple in market capitalization, signaling a shift in investor confidence. Apple's shares fell 3% in the previous session, reflecting existing negative sentiment. The focus on Nvidia's growth and investment in AI contrasts with Apple's current standing, which may lead investors to be wary of Apple's competitive position in the tech sector. While Apple's strong fundamentals may provide some cushion, the immediate impact from this news appears more negative. Thus, I estimate a higher likelihood of the stock price falling short-term, though there could be opportunities for recovery in the medium to long-term.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news highlights Nvidia surpassing Apple in market capitalization, and Apple's stock falling 3% in the previous session. This indicates negative momentum. While Apple is mentioned in the context of other companies, the overall sentiment is not favorable. Previous models mostly leaned towards a higher probability of the stock falling. Considering the previous predictions and the current context, the negative pressure on Apple's stock seems significant.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.38, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.62, Reasoning: The news focuses on Nvidia's surge and its overtaking of Apple in market capitalization.  While this is negative for Apple's relative standing, it doesn't directly address Apple's fundamentals or future prospects.  The 3% drop in AAPL the previous session is a key factor suggesting existing negative sentiment.  However,  Apple's strong brand and diverse product portfolio could mitigate the negative impact of this news.  Considering the previous predictions leaning towards a higher probability of a fall, but with some also giving it  a relatively small chance of rising, I temper the negative sentiment somewhat.  The lack of specific news directly affecting Apple leads me to a prediction closer to neutrality, with a slight tilt towards a price fall.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights Nvidia overtaking Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. This suggests a negative sentiment towards Apple in the short term, especially with the focus on AI and Nvidia's involvement in the 'Stargate Project'. While Apple remains a strong company with solid fundamentals, the immediate impact of this news and the comparative performance of Nvidia may lead to a higher probability of Apple's stock price falling. The lack of direct positive news for Apple in this context further supports this view.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights that Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. This change in market capitalization ranking, combined with the recent stock price decline, suggests a potential downward trend for Apple's stock price. The positive sentiment around Nvidia and the AI sector may further contribute to Apple's relative decline. However, Apple's strong fundamentals and ecosystem may mitigate some downside risk. Considering the comparative performance and the overall market context, there is a higher likelihood of Apple's stock price falling in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.32, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.68, Reasoning: The news highlights Nvidia overtaking Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. This indicates a negative short-term impact on Apple's stock price due to the comparative performance of Nvidia. However, considering the overall market and sector performance, as well as Apple's strong fundamentals and ecosystem, the probabilities should reflect a balance between the immediate negative sentiment and the potential for recovery or stability. Given the information and the trend of others' predictions, which seem to lean towards a higher probability of the stock price falling, it's reasonable to estimate that the probability of the stock price falling is higher than the probability of it rising. Yet, the difference should not be overly skewed, as Apple's inherent value and market position still support a significant chance of the stock price stabilizing or rising in response to various market factors.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The financial news highlights that Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. The news emphasizes the success of AI-focused companies like Nvidia, which could lead to shifts in investor sentiment. Several models predict a higher probability of stock price falling due to the recent performance and relative competitive position of Apple. However, Apple's strong fundamentals and ongoing innovations may provide some support against a significant decline.

}
